sentence.Network_en: If she showed any tendency to coquetry he would be apt to straighten her tie, or if she " took up " with him at all, to call her by her first name.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果那女子露出点卖弄风情的品性,他就会上前去帮她理理领带, 如果她 ‘ 吃 ’ 他那一套献殷勤的手段, 他马上开始用小名称呼她了.

sentence.Network_en: She laughed, twisting her shoulder in a horrible parody of coquetry.
sentence.Network_cn: 她笑了, 一面扭动着肩膀,做出一副肉麻的卖弄风情的姿态.

sentence.Network_en: The moment she met a man she would play the coquetry.
sentence.Network_cn: 她一见到男人就卖弄风骚.

list.abs: Learn to be mischievous and coquetry ., 学会恰到好处地撒娇调皮.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French coquetterie, from coqueter 'to flirt', from coquet 'wanton' (see coquette)

means.word_mean: 1. playful behavior intended to arouse sexual interest

auth_sentence.content: Maybe, too busy to learn the nuances of adult social interaction, she hit upon coquetry as a way of dealing with the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe, too busy to learn the nuances of adult social interaction, she hit upon coquetry as a way of dealing with the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe, too busy to learn the nuances of adult social interaction, she hit upon coquetry as a way of dealing with the world.

auth_sentence.content: She preferred to keep the genteel preliminaries coquetry, foreplay, drinks, a friendly hello as brief as possible.
auth_sentence.res_content: She preferred to keep the genteel preliminaries coquetry, foreplay, drinks, a friendly hello as brief as possible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She preferred to keep the genteel preliminaries coquetry, foreplay, drinks, a friendly hello as brief as possible.

auth_sentence.content: In his books, he speaks of Queenie's coquetry, and of her jealousy, which he regards as a female characteristic.

sentences.en: If she showed any tendency to coquetry he would be apt to straighten her tie, or if she “took up” with him at all, to call her by her first name.
sentences.cn: 如果那女子露出点卖弄风情的品性，他就会上前去帮她理理领带,如果她‘吃’他那一套献殷勤的手段，他马上开始用小名称呼她了。
